page.title: 13Kingstag or King's Stag
page.content: Our block only contains part of this hamlet but it does have the village name sign in it.According to the County Council it is Kingstag whereas the O.S. map and the parish call it King's Stag. As the name implies a {"Beautifull and goodly White Hart"}was killed here to the annoyance of Henry 111. The {Memorial Chapel}was built in 1914 to replace the 1884 one in memory of Lady Barbara Yeatman-Biggs by her husband who was the first Bishop of the newly created Coventry diocese. At this time land was also given for a burial ground ajoining the chapel so that from then Kingstag parishioners are buried in the hamlet and no longer by the parish church at Stock.
